channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Broken sunken paving slabs., 18th November
item.description:
Pavement outside 55 Therapia Road. Broken paving slabs have subsided, creating a trip hazard with adjacent slabs on one side and tarmac on the other. I fell there on Saturday and have only now been able to check on what caused me to fall

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Therapia Road, Nunhead, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Victoria Road, Donaldson to Hazelmere, 18th November
item.description:
Piles of leaves are now knee deep and in some places mean residents can only get by by walking in the road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Victoria Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car is parked in dangerous position., 18th November
item.description:
Car is parked on a single yellow line at end of Siward Road near the junction with Wendover Road. It is an obstruction to vehicles using the junction.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Siward Road, Widmore, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly Tipping, 18th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmer Road, Catford South, Catford, London Borough of Lewisham

item.title: Debris from rough sleeping, 18th November
item.description:
The rough sleeper has moved on and the debri left behind is soaking wet and in two places behind the Old Passport office. In a door well and also by the benches under the tree.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 89, Eccleston Square, Victoria, City of Westminster

item.title: Rubbish behind 223 Bellegrove Road, 18th November
item.description:
There is a load of rubbish behind 223 - 231 Bellegrove Road. There is a cooker, clothing, shoes, empty boxes, broken toys. There are wheelie bins that block entrances to the flats above. This has attracted rats.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12,12A, Welling Way, Falconwood, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fixed paving slabs have caused trip hazard, 18th November
item.description:
Workers recently fixed paving slabs at the end of my drive (the pavement is on Birchwood ave Da14) and in the process, 2 of my driveway bricks were lifted and not put back correctly - they are now slightly lifted and concreted in place meaning there is a big trip hazard. I am an 81 year old lady and am worried about myself of my guests having an accident on entering my property. This trip hazard definitely did not exist prior to the workers fixing the pavement and therefore I would like it corrected asap before someone has an accident.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Birchwood Avenue, Albany Park, Sidcup, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Been there for weeka, plus street is full of litter either side - not cleaned regularly enough
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sheep Lane, Hackney, London

item.title: Damaged abandoned van blocking pavement, 18th November
item.description:
This car has been abandoned here for 3 months. It has been in an accident and dumped here. It is blocking the pavement to wheelchairs and pushchairs forcing them to walk in the road. The wing mirror is also snapped off with exposed metal that can cause injury if you brushed passed it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Winchcomb Gardens, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large quantity of rubbish near Hatherley Crescent., 18th November
item.description:
Large quantity of rubbish built up against building. Easily accessible to members of the public - could cause injury or fuel an incident. Rubbish has been present for at least a few weeks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alma Road, Longlands, Sidcup, London Borough of Bexley
